meanings.definition: Make (something) more resilient or able to withstand rough handling.
meanings.sent1: The company ruggedized their new phone to survive drops and spills.
meanings.sent2: The military ruggedized their equipment for use in extreme environments.
meanings.sent3: The chef ruggedized the delicate souffle recipe to endure a busy kitchen.
meanings.sent4: She ruggedized her resolve to face the challenges ahead.
meanings.sent5: The hiker ruggedized his backpack for the long journey ahead.

meanings.definition: Strengthen or toughen (something) for harsh conditions.
meanings.sent1: The construction workers ruggedized the building to withstand strong winds.
meanings.sent2: The athletes ruggedized their training regimen for the upcoming competition.
meanings.sent3: The students ruggedized their study group to tackle the difficult exam.
meanings.sent4: She ruggedized her heart after the painful breakup.
meanings.sent5: The gardener ruggedized the plants against the harsh winter frost.
